intro: Monnina angustata, commonly known as narrowleaf monnina, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to purple, clustered in dense spikes, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Monnina angustata is part of the family Onagraceae, which includes other flowering plants with showy, often bilaterally symmetrical flowers.
